paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant R56Q, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband (P1) experienced syncope at age 20 and was diagnosed with LQTS2 at age 22.

individual_records.phenotype_details: had a family history of sudden cardiac death
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P2 had a family history of sudden cardiac death and was diagnosed with LQTS2 at age 29.
Patient P3 is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.
Patient P4 was diagnosed with LQTS2 after experiencing arrhythmia at age 36.

functional_data.summary: The R56Q variant showed altered channel kinetics, leading to reduced repolarizing current.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the potential therapeutic effects of RPR260243 on the R56Q variant.
key_quotes: The hERG channel activator RPR260243 restores the repolarizing current of a mutant variant of the channel associated with LQTS2.
Loss of functional IKr current in inherited or acquired LQTS results in delayed repolarization of cardiac muscle.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant R56Q was successfully extracted.
